Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly early patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: narrow black band at top of rim, reserved below (slip worn); inscription on outside.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), temenos (said to be)
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces of the sherd make it difficult to determine to what style it belongs. Early patterned chalices have no decoration on either side of the chalice walls.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0309) (phase 2)
